My postgraduate work nearly 25 years ago was in natural language processing & when I looked under the bonnet at ChatGPT etc. I was really expecting there to have been some magical leap forward. But the basic methods are the same - bigger datasets, better computation, that's all.

Username: Let's Go Back To Common Law!
Content:
FYI: The way "AI" LLMs like ChatGPT work...

It's basically just a database.
Databases are completely dead.

A better phrase for them would be "Simulated Intelligence".

"AI" will never be intelligent, because they will never actually *understand* anything.
